references.reason: This paper introduces DreamFusion, a groundbreaking method that leverages pre-trained 2D diffusion models for text-to-3D generation, eliminating the need for 3D training data and significantly improving the quality of generated 3D content.

references.paper_title: High-Resolution Image Synthesis with Latent Diffusion Models
references.reason: This work introduces Latent Diffusion Models (LDMs), a powerful class of generative models that achieve state-of-the-art performance in image synthesis and are fundamental to many recent text-to-3D methods, including StrandHead, which uses them for texture generation.

references.paper_title: Learning Transferable Visual Models From Natural Language Supervision
references.reason: This paper presents CLIP, a crucial model that learns visual representations from natural language supervision, enabling text-guided generation and optimization in numerous text-to-3D approaches.

references.paper_title: Deep Marching Tetrahedra: a Hybrid Representation for High-Resolution 3D Shape Synthesis
references.reason: This work proposes DMTet, a hybrid 3D representation that combines SDFs and differentiable marching tetrahedra, providing an efficient and effective way to represent and optimize 3D shapes, which is used by StrandHead for head modeling.

references.paper_title: Learning a model of facial shape and expression from 4D scans
references.reason: This paper introduces FLAME, a parametric 3D head model that is widely used in head avatar generation methods, offering a compact and expressive representation of head shape, pose, and expressions, which is leveraged by StrandHead for initial head geometry.
